definition: house/room/CL:間|间[jian1]/branch of an extended family/classifier for family members (or concubines)

sentences.english: Housing prices in Shanghai have doubled.The main index of the Shanghai stock exchange just passed 6,000 - up more than fivefold in two years.
sentences.chinese: 上海的房價已經翻了一倍。

sentences.english: Shanghai property market with high prices of 14 major suspenseful who say that low?
sentences.chinese: 上海樓市14大懸疑之房價高與低該誰說了算？

sentences.english: In China's big cities, real estate's expensive and young women are in short supply.
sentences.chinese: 中國的大城市，房價高企，年輕女子的行市緊俏。

sentences.english: High home prices keep middle-income and upper-income residents here renting.
sentences.chinese: 紐約的高房價讓中高收入的居民也會租房。

sentences.english: Even so, other reports showed big drops in housing sales in May. That followed the end of a homebuyer's tax credit.
sentences.chinese: 即便如此，其他報告顯示五月房價大幅度下跌。

sentences.english: The worst cities are clustered in former housing bubble areas like Florida and California.
sentences.chinese: 最糟糕的城市集中在先前房價瘋長的佛羅里達和加州。

sentences.english: Therefore the government must continue to prop up housing prices or provide incentives to encourage people to buy homes.
sentences.chinese: 因此，政府必須繼續推高房價或者激勵人們買房子。

sentences.english: And it’s starting to hurt those who bought years before the housing boom began.
sentences.chinese: 這又殃及前數年於房價開始大升而購入的人士。

sentences.english: After a couple of brief growth spurts, home prices have started declining again in earnest.
sentences.chinese: 經過幾次短暫的增長，房價又實實在在地開始下滑。

sentences.english: The results show that the rising trend of housing price has a significant crowding-out effect on aggregate consumption.
sentences.chinese: 結果表明，房價持續上漲對消費具有明顯的擠出效應。

sentences.english: Mothers-in-law improve the rising housing price.
sentences.chinese: 丈母孃鞭促房價高歌猛進。

sentences.english: The house prices in the city seemed soaring up without limit.
sentences.chinese: 這個城市的房價好像在無限制地飛漲。

sentences.english: Prices may be down but the risks have also grown.
sentences.chinese: 房價雖然下跌，但購房風險同時也增大了。

sentences.english: Skyrocketing housing prices have other social effects as well.
sentences.chinese: 飛漲的房價還造成其他的社會影響。

sentences.english: That's about where prices stood in 2004 in both towns.
sentences.chinese: 這就是兩個鎮2004年大概的房價。

sentences.english: even just to go out and eat at restaurant is very expensive here.
sentences.chinese: 房價非常高，餐廳的消費也高。

definition: property/real estate/abbr. for 物業管理|物业管理[wu4 ye4 guan3 li3], property management
to get on or into (a bus, train, car etc)
